title: Past + Future Snapshots
shortDescription: Each shares one memory that shaped them and one dream that excites them.

shortDescription: Sit together in silence, hands touching, breathing slow.

shortDescription: Cook, draw, or build something together that symbolizes your bond

shortDescription: Make a vision collage or digital board of shared dreams.

shortDescription: Name one way you’ll support each other’s next step.

title: Gift of Words

title: Relationship as Garden

shortDescription: Talk about where you’d like to be, individually and together, a year from now.

title: What We’ve Become
shortDescription: Reflect on how your love has changed you

title: Through Each Season
shortDescription: Describe what you’ve learned from each phase together

shortDescription: Write one intention for the future and revisit it in a year

title: Timeline of Us
shortDescription: Sketch or voice-note 5 milestones of your journey

shortDescription: Sit close, sync your breath for a minute; feel each other’s presence.

title: Inner Weather Report
shortDescription: Each partner names their inner weather: “Today I feel cloudy/sunny/stormy…” No fixing, just witnessing.

shortDescription: Hold hands silently for 30 seconds before speaking.

title: What’s Been Between Us

shortDescription: Share one small truth you’ve been holding back.

title: Memory Sparks
shortDescription: Recall one warm shared moment.

title: One Shared Song

shortDescription: Rate connection 1–10 and share briefly.

title: Mini Gratitude Exchange

shortDescription: Leave a brief “thinking of you” note weekly.

title: Shared Stillness
shortDescription: Sit quietly, eyes closed, imagining being on the same emotional team.

title: One Truth, One Tenderness

title: Right Now, I’m With You

title: What I Think You Might Be Feeling
shortDescription: Guess what your partner might be feeling; they confirm or adjust.

title: Emotion Echo

title: Feeling Words Deck
shortDescription: Pick 3 feeling words each to describe your state and share why.

title: The “I Miss You” Letter

title: Appreciation Round
shortDescription: Name one small thing your partner did recently that made you feel loved.

title: Gentle Touch Pause
shortDescription: Hold your partner’s face or hand softly while saying one kind thing.

shortDescription: 15 minutes of one-way sharing, then switch. No interruptions.

shortDescription: Each says one intention for how they’ll stay connected tomorrow.

title: Quiet Closure
shortDescription: Sit quietly for a minute holding hands, breathing gratitude for being heard.

title: Sensory Sync

title: Light and Touch
shortDescription: Dim lights, light a candle, and let silence settle before talking.

title: Look Again

title: One Lovely Thing
shortDescription: Each shares one small thing you find attractive or endearing today.

title: Memory Flash

title: Mini Dare Game

title: Evening Spark
shortDescription: Choose one tiny ritual (kiss, candle, word) to repeat nightly.

title: Whisper Note

title: Quiet Wrap
shortDescription: End by holding each other in silence for a minute before sleep.

title: Morning Glimpse
shortDescription: Share one thing you’re curious or excited about today.

title: One Beautiful Thing
shortDescription: Name one small beauty around you (light, smell, sound).

title: Mirror Moment
shortDescription: Compliment your partner as they get ready — something small and sincere.

title: Micro-Hug Pause
shortDescription: Hug for 5 seconds each time you cross paths during the day.

title: Mini Check-In
shortDescription: Share one word for how you’re feeling right now.

shortDescription: Draw each other in 1 minute — compare results.

title: Care Act

shortDescription: Each day, jot one tiny joyful moment together in a shared note.

title: Nightlight Note

title: Mini Ritual Calendar
shortDescription: Pick one day a week for a micro-adventure or treat.

title: Quiet Touch
shortDescription: Sit close, place your hand gently on your partner's arm or back or heart, just breathing together for 1 minute.

title: Shared Breaths
shortDescription: Sit facing each other, match your breathing for a few cycles; let your gaze soften.

title: What Touch Feels Safe
shortDescription: Share what kinds of touch feel most comforting vs. overwhelming.

title: Body Gratitude
shortDescription: Name one thing you appreciate about your partner’s body — its strength, softness, warmth, or presence.

title: Touch Memories
shortDescription: Recall a memory of a time you felt deeply connected through touch.

title: Palm Play
shortDescription: Explore each other’s hands with slow curiosity; trace, squeeze, draw circles.

shortDescription: Choose a soft song, hold each other, and sway to music, syncing breath and rhythm naturally, without talking.

title: Laughing Contact
shortDescription: Play a light game like mirroring each other’s movements or dancing goofily.

title: Comfort Blanket Moment
shortDescription: Lie or sit together under one blanket, no talking, just shared warmth.

title: Scent and Touch
shortDescription: Use a favorite oil or lotion, take turns applying it on hands or arms.

title: Body Map of Care
shortDescription: With clothes on, trace outlines of each other’s arms, shoulders, back — saying “thank you” for each part.

title: Goodnight Touch
shortDescription: Every night, share one small touch before sleep — a forehead kiss, hand on heart, or arm squeeze.

title: Sunday Morning Snuggle
shortDescription: Set aside one morning a week for lazy cuddles or shared warmth.

title: Touch Token
shortDescription: Each gives a small token or note representing how they want to be touched or held.

title: Compliment Tag
shortDescription: Take turns giving one flirty or funny compliment — no repeats.

title: Eyes Only
shortDescription: For 60 seconds, hold eye contact without speaking — then describe what you noticed.

title: “If You Were...” Game
shortDescription: Finish prompts like “If you were a flavor / song / texture, you’d be…”

title: Texture Hunt

title: Blindfold Mystery
shortDescription: One is blindfolded, the other touches their hand or arm with everyday objects; guess each one.

title: Favorite Scent Swap
shortDescription: Let each other smell something you love — perfume, lotion, spice — and share the memory it evokes.

title: T-shirt Tug
shortDescription: Playfully pull each other’s shirts just enough to make each other smile; light and teasing.

title: Doodle on Me
shortDescription: Use your finger to “draw” shapes or words on each other’s back; the other guesses.

title: Pillow Toss Game
shortDescription: Lightly toss a soft pillow back and forth; whoever drops it shares something they find attractive.

title: Rhythm Touch
shortDescription: Take turns tapping or tracing to the beat of a slow song on each other’s skin.

title: Body Temperature Play
shortDescription: Alternate warm (hands, breath) and cool (ice cube, breeze) sensations lightly on hands or arms.

title: Secret Signal
shortDescription: Create a private signal (gesture, word, emoji) that means “I’m thinking of you.”

title: 30-Second Kiss
shortDescription: Once a day, pause whatever you’re doing and share a slow, uninterrupted kiss.

title: Playful Message Drop
shortDescription: Leave flirty or funny notes in random spots during the week.

title: Daily Load Check-In
shortDescription: Each shares one word for their physical and mental energy today.

title: Invisible List
shortDescription: Silently write 5 daily tasks you handle; then share and notice surprises.

title: Temperature Check
shortDescription: Rate your stress (1–10); listen without fixing.

title: Who Holds What
shortDescription: Map out tasks under “Me / You / Shared / Dropped.” Reflect kindly.

title: Appreciation Round
shortDescription: Name one invisible thing the other does that makes your life easier.

title: Fairness Swap
shortDescription: Each chooses one small task to swap for a week, just to understand.

shortDescription: Agree on a short daily “no chores” time to just breathe together.

title: 15-Minute Tidy Team

shortDescription: Tell each other: “One thing I see you doing lately that I hadn’t said thanks for.”

title: Love Receipt

title: Weekly Huddle
shortDescription: Once a week, review what’s working and adjust one small thing.

shortDescription: Pick a song that represents your teamwork; play it on chore days.

shortDescription: End the week with a small drink or treat together, celebrating “Team Us.”

title: Weight Drop
shortDescription: Say out loud one thing you’re putting down for the day.

title: “Today Felt Heavy When…”
shortDescription: Each finishes that sentence once.

title: The Kind Voice
shortDescription: Speak to your partner as if comforting a dear friend.

title: Silent Thank You
shortDescription: Look at each other and think one thing you’re thankful for — no words.

title: Hand-Hold Meditation
shortDescription: Hold hands and feel the pulse, focusing on warmth between palms.

title: Comfort Swap
shortDescription: Each says, “Right now, I need…” and the other offers a small comfort.

shortDescription: Hold each other until both sigh.

shortDescription: Play calming music or dim lights for 5 mins together.

title: Tomorrow’s Soft Start
shortDescription: Plan one tiny ease for tomorrow morning together.

title: Name It Gently

title: Tender Note
shortDescription: Write a small message: “One thing I see you carrying bravely is…” Leave it somewhere for your partner.

title: Warm Palms

title: Together Statement

shortDescription: Sit back-to-back and lean gently into each other, feeling shared support.

title: Tiny Hope Plan
shortDescription: Name one small nurturing act you’ll each do this week (walk, rest, talk).

title: Mini Silence
shortDescription: Sit together in quiet for one minute; let silence soften the nervous system.

title: Breath Check
shortDescription: Ask each other, “How’s your breath right now?” Then take three slower ones together.

title: Tension Melt
shortDescription: Take turns massaging each other’s shoulders or necks for a few minutes in silence, while breathing slowly, focusing only on comfort.

shortDescription: Close your eyes, imagine the wind carrying away what’s too heavy to hold.

title: Quiet Tea Time
shortDescription: Make tea together in silence, sip slowly side by side.

title: Safe Words
shortDescription: Choose two comfort words for the week (“anchor,” “soft”); say them when either feels tense.

title: Palm Kiss
shortDescription: Before sleep, press a soft kiss into your partner’s palm.

title: Future Note

title: Evening Thank You
shortDescription: Before bed, say: “One small thing I appreciated about you today is…”

title: Reset Phrase
shortDescription: Agree on a gentle word (e.g., “pause”) to signal a break when emotions rise.

title: Love Gratitude
